greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Replace 4^k with (-4)^k in base 4 expansion of n.
comment: Base 4 representation for n (in lexicographic order) converted from base -4 to base 10.
link: Dana G. Korssjoen, Biyao Li, Stefan Steinerberger, Raghavendra Tripathi, and Ruimin Zhang, Finding structure in sequences of real numbers via graph theory: a problem list, arXiv:2012.04625, Dec 08, 2020
formula: a(4*k+m) = -4*a(k)+m for 0 <= m < 4. - _Chai Wah Wu_, Jan 16 2020
mathematica: f[n_Integer, b_Integer] := Block[{l = IntegerDigits[n]}, Sum[l[[ -i]]*(-b)^(i - 1), {i, 1, Length[l]}]]; a = Table[ FromDigits[ IntegerDigits[n, 4]], {n, 0, 80}]; b = {}; Do[b = Append[b, f[a[[n]], 4]], {n, 1, 80}]; b
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 12 2002
